This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of generative artificial intelligence, focusing on large language models. Students will learn how to design, train, and deploy generative AI systems, with a particular emphasis on Large Language Models. They will explore the principles, applications, and ethical considerations surrounding these technologies. The course describes in detail the transformer architecture that powers LLMs, how they’re trained, and how fine-tuning enables LLMs to be adapted to a variety of specific use cases.

textBooks.title: Generative Deep Learning: Teaching Machines to Paint, Write, Compose, and Play
textBooks.author: David Foster

textBooks.title: Generative AI with LangChain: Build large language model (LLM) apps with Python, ChatGPT, and other LLMs
textBooks.author: Ben Auffarth

referenceLinks.title: Attention is all you need
referenceLinks.authors: Vaswani, Ashish, Noam Shazeer, Niki Parmar, Jakob Uszkoreit, Llion Jones, Aidan N. Gomez, Łukasz Kaiser, and Illia Polosukhin
referenceLinks.journal: Advances in neural information processing systems

referenceLinks.title: Generative Pre-trained Transformer: A Comprehensive Review on Enabling Technologies, Potential Applications, Emerging Challenges, and Future Directions
referenceLinks.authors: Yenduri, Gokul, Gautam Srivastava, Praveen Kumar Reddy Maddikunta, Rutvij H. Jhaveri, Weizheng Wang, Athanasios V. Vasilakos, and Thippa Reddy Gadekallu

referenceLinks.title: Trustworthy LLMs: a Survey and Guideline for Evaluating Large Language Models' Alignment
referenceLinks.authors: Liu, Yang, Yuanshun Yao, Jean-Francois Ton, Xiaoying Zhang, Ruocheng Guo Hao Cheng, Yegor Klochkov, Muhammad Faaiz Taufiq, and Hang Li

End Term Project Evaluation.duration: During the last two weeks of the course

CO1.description: Develop a deep understanding of generative AI principles, encompassing various generative models and their practical applications for diverse real-world scenarios.

CO2.description: Apply Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), LLMs, and Sequence Models specifically Seq2Seq models and Variational Autoencoders (VA2Es), strategies for designing effective prompts.

CO3.description: Evaluate frameworks that ensure the responsible deployment of generative models, fostering a commitment to ethical considerations.
